page.title: 14NON-CONFORMIST CHAPEL
page.content: Meetings of this congregation{began {about a hundred years ago in a tent}in someone's garden. Regent Chapel bought the{land}which{cost Â£20 on 29th {September 1891.}A corrugated iron building was erected in October 1891 and the building was brought into use in November1891.{A brand new}stone and wood{building}has been{erected}around the old structure which has now been removed leaving a bright modern wooden interior.{Sunday services .}10 a.m. Communion except last Sunday of the month when 10.30a.m. Family Service is held. Evening service 6.30p.m. Tuesday{-Prayer Meeting}7p.m., Wednesday{Jucoes Club}8-12, 6 p.m. {Bible Study and Prayer Meeting 8 p.m. Friday{Inters Club,}ages 12-16. Jucoes and Inters go to camp in Wales each year.
